definition: sour/tart/sick at heart/grieved/sore/aching/pedantic/impractical/to make sarcastic remarks about sb/an acid

sentences.english: These days, the comments are more acerbic.
sentences.chinese: 而这些天，人们对他的评论更为尖酸。

sentences.english: Never be afraid to test yourself by your critic's words.
sentences.chinese: 千万不用害怕接受尖酸刻薄言词的考验。

sentences.english: Yes, he has an acerbic sense of humor that sometimes offends people.
sentences.chinese: 没错，他有种尖酸刻薄的幽默感，有时会得罪人。

sentences.english: Usually we are more satirical from vanity than malice.
sentences.chinese: 通常，人们的尖酸刻薄来自于虚荣心而非恶意。

sentences.english: In any case, this is all a bit nit-picky.
sentences.chinese: 在任何情况下，这都是一位尖酸刻薄。

sentences.english: No one wants to make a friend with her , due to her pungency .
sentences.chinese: 由于她的尖酸刻薄，没人愿意与她交朋友。

sentences.english: She was given to using bitter sarcasm.
sentences.chinese: 她惯于用尖酸刻薄语言挖苦人。

sentences.english: He could smell the pine, the tartness of nearby tree sap.
sentences.chinese: 他又嗅到松树和附近树汁尖酸的气味。

sentences.english: Madame de Stael, a French writer of the Napoleonic period, was renowned for her cutting tongue.
sentences.chinese: 拿破仑时代法国作家斯塔尔夫人以说话尖酸著名。

sentences.english: Simon is the most acerbic judge on "American Idol".
sentences.chinese: 西蒙是“美国偶像”中最尖酸刻薄的评委。

sentences.english: Norcom. These days, the comments are more acerbic.
sentences.chinese: 而这些天，人们对他的评论更为尖酸。
